header.headertext: AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED IN COMMITTEE

text.quote: 000: Clause 85, page 72, line 33, at end insert “and having regard to the promotion of integration with care and support provision required by section 88(1)(h).”
000: Clause 85, page 72, line 36, at end insert—
“( ) HEE must seek to ensure that it receives representations from relevant organisations to define sufficient workplace and appropriate skill mix.”
000: Clause 88, page 74, line 36, at end insert—
text.IndentOne: “(k) guidance and standards on staffing levels.”

text.quote: 000: Clause 97, page 80, line 35, at end insert “and the publication of its findings fairly and frankly”
000: Clause 1, page 2, line 31, at end insert—
“( ) In exercising any function under this Part the Secretary of State shall also have regard to the principles of well-being for individuals in subsection (2).”
000: Clause 3, page 3, line 41, at end insert—

“( ) In pursuit of integrating care and support with other relevant services, a local authority is enabled to participate in any form of joint working or funding with such services without let or hindrance.”
000: Clause 4, page 4, line 11, at end insert—

“( ) A local authority must only offer a financial product to pay for care to people who have received regulated financial advice or are customers who have opted out of taking regulated financial advice.”
000: Clause 4, page 4, line 19, leave out paragraph (d) and insert—
text.IndentOne: “( ) how to access information and advice on matters likely to be relevant to adults who have needs for care and support or are making plans for meeting needs for care and support that might arise, including mandatory regulated financial advice for those taking out a care-related financial product, and”

text.quote: 000: Clause 13, page 12, line 22, at end insert—
“( ) In making regulations under this section, the Secretary of State must have regard to—
text.IndentOne: (b) preventing the need for NHS Services,
(c) establishing criteria for service provision that applies to all local authorities in England without variation in charging policies between areas,
(d) making available funding to meet the requirements of paragraph (c).”

text.quote: 000: Clause 15, page 13, line 46, at end insert—
“( ) The Secretary of State has a duty to make people aware of the terms of the cap on the cost of care through a national public awareness campaign.”
000: Before Clause 66, insert the following new Clause—
“Review by the Office for Budget Responsibility
text.IndentOne: The Secretary of State must on enactment ask the Office for Budget Responsibility to complete by the end of 2014 a review of the funding of adult social care that assesses—
(a) the adequacy of current public funding of these services;
(b) the proposals for funding the provision in this Act; and
(c) the implications of the Act and its funding for the NHS over the next five years.”
